dialogues.text: Reaches his hand out. She is closer. But shaky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (white) They're both gonna die... ARE YOU  HAPPY YOU COCKSUCKERS!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray goes after Tom Baker and the Film Crew. A scuffle.  Yelling, shouting, but down below in the intimacy of the  ledge, blowing out on the edge, the wind and the world an death. Two crazy children linked on this gothic balcony o the Chateau reach their hands out for each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on baby, come on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quoting him) "...but one, the most beautiful one  of all -- dances in a ring of fire -- "

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (raw singing) "I see your hair is burning. If they  say I never loved you, you know they  are a liar!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "...and throws off the challenge  with a shrug"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the poetry has wolves in it Pam!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has never been so concentrated, inching closer to him Her heels overhanging oblivion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't wanna die with you Jim  Morrison, I don't wanna die!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JIM & DOORS  Never saw a woman  So alone (X2)  So alone -- lone lone

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon Pam, this is it! We'll do it  right here! Right now! You and me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray, Tom, Siddons, Mike, Dog, they all watch in horror,  sensing it will happen. They have even stopped filming.  Inches... inches. He dodges her touch, confused... to the last possible sec Then SHE'S THERE -- in his arms. Her arms latch around hi and she hugs him with all her wiry soul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim -- let's go, let's leave this  town! You and me! Never come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (demonic) We can. Right now. Just one more  step...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Jim. I want to LIVE with you. I  want to LIVE with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two lovers huddled together on the ledge. He slips hi head down on her lap, looking up into her eyes with the  strangest tears in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a poem) There was preserved in her the fresh  miracle of surprise... clothed in  sunlight restless in wanting dying  of fever married to doubt how it has  changed you how slowly estranged you  solely arranged you beg for your  mercy -- OR -- ...but all will pass  lie down in green grass and smile  and muse and gaze upon her smooth  resemblance to the mating-Queen who  it seems is in love with the horseman  Tomorrow we enter the tomb of my  birth I want to be ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On her face -- moved. Pause. LA WOMAN floods in on his sm an upbeat surge. Upstairs, the ONLOOKERS relax. HOTEL MANAGEMENT and COPS now rushing up in background. JIM & DOORS  Mr. Mojo Rising  Mr. Mojo Risin' (X2)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's music rocking from the inside. Cables and baffles run from the second story down to the rehearsal room on t first. JIM & DOORS  Keep on risin'  Got to keep on risin'  Risin' Risin' (X8)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SECRETARIES and STAFF dance to the SOUND rocking thru the floor. JIM & DOORS  Well I just got into town about an hour ago  Took a look around, see which way the wind blow Camera moving thru the offices, past the OFFICE BOY, past SIDDONS, past the PUBLICIST, etc -- a farewell to the ban

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see RAY, ROBBIE, JOHN, BOTNICK, a BASS and 2nd RHYTHM  GUITARIST, WIVES, GIRLFRIENDS but no Jim. They're really  driving, the music soars. PAMELA'S hair shaking as she sw to the beat. JIM & DOORS With a little girl in a Hollywood  bungalow  Are you a lucky lady in the City of  Light?  Or just another lost angel -- City  of Night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wires run into a tiny toilet revealing JIM with headphone to his ears barking into a dangling mike, one leg propped a toilet seat, in a groove. A new, strange, unparalleled  beauty in his voice, hoarser but wiser, haunted by experi yet joyful as youth, Jim is ironically, at his best. JIM & DOORS LA Woman (X2)  LA Woman / Sunday Afternoon (X3)  Drive thru your suburbs  Into your blues (X2)  Into your blue-blue blues

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MONTAGE: Moving, moving, moving -- all the POVS from fast moving CARS travelling with the pace of L.A. Song of free of escape -- the STRIP, the cars, the freeway, the  BILLBOARDS... farewell L.A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camera creeping towards ANNE O'RIORDAN as she waits, alon on a white table for the doctor to arrive. Jim never show up after all. But on we go. JIM & DOORS  I see your hair is burning  Hills are filled with fire  If they say I never lov'd you  You know they are a liar (etc)  Never saw a woman  So alone (X2)  So alone lone lone  So alone

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JIM drives up in his beaten GTO MUSTANG, top down, bags a over the place, hops out. Carrying his bulk with grace, k and rings. RIDERS ON THE STORM starting to play over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOROTHY opens the door. Jim a stack of presents under his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eek Dorothy! You cut your hair!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're trying to have another baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moving past her) What -- was your hair getting in the  way? (she smacks him lightly) Where are the kids?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He spots them, crossing to the YARD where a CHILDREN'S  BIRTHDAY is in progress -- TWO DOZEN KIDS, a CLOWN acting out for them. A few parents and friends -- ROBBIE and LYN their kid, JOHN and his RECENT LADY, their kid... When the KIDS spot JIM they light up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey -- am I late or is this the cool  remnant of a dream?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rushing to him) Eee! Jim! It's Uncle Jim... Come  on... what did you bring me Jim...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (picks up Robin) How's my girl! And how's my boy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stick a ludicrous printed birthday hat on his head. bearded Santa Claus now engulfed with kids, though puffy, body gone, a literal physical wreck, yet a gentle pathos  about him and still a charisma that the children react to without thinking. He gives out the presents all over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ad libs) For you... Pancho gets this one...  Melanie -- yours... Hey Dorothy don't  grab now... open that one, that's  yours... keep your paws off that  now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As RAY and ROBBIE and JOHN and the others circle him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Robin, a 5 year  old) ...and to you, princess, from your  Royal servant, James Douglas Morrison (bows)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As ROBIN, the cutest of them all, a bow in her hair, take the package, opens it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna hear the new mixes on "LA  WOMAN?"...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I gotta plane to catch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Won't take long man, it's the best  one since "Days".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We added rain to "Riders", come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim cocks his head, listening to it playing from an inner room, his eyes on ROBIN opening the gift -- a beautiful,  ANTIQUE DOLL of an 19th century poet -- rock star, stuffe velour jacket, white fluffy lace collar, it could be Byro or it could be Jim Morrison -- in fact the hair is perfec weaved to resemble Jim in his young lion phase -- an iron gift, meant from the heart. It stops everybody -- they al look. A haunted quality to the doll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugh! What's that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jim) It's you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forever young...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kisses him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh it's beautiful... Thank you Uncle  Jim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off the patio windows of the birthday party, sounds and  sunshine pouring in. The Clown running around, laughter. music plays -- BRUCE at the mixing board. JIM & DOORS  Riders on the Storm (x2)  Into this house we're born  Into this world we're thrown  Like a dog without a bone  An actor out on loan  Riders on the storm Where we and Jim came in, I guess. Jim drinks from a cogn bottle straight, foot tapping, enjoying it, knows it's go but other things are calling. This is history.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta admit -- that ain't bad for  four guys who weren't even talking  that day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slapping shoulders, shaking hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really gonna live in Paris man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah John, be anonymous, write a  book: "Observations of an American  While on Trial in Miami".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still think we got a couple of  great blues albums in us man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm pinned man. Everything I do they  got a category for it, y'know.  Freedom's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm gonna miss you Jim. I'm  gonna miss the feeling of playing  music with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can always whip the horses' eyes.  You, John, miss me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More than you think asshole. (turn away, repressing --  the emotions)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (walking him to the  garden) Well far as I'm concerned, Jim, I  made music with Dionysus man. We had  some moments on stage like no one  will ever fucking know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (making light) Yeah, yeah -- and you lay off those  drugs Rob. We're gonna play again  some day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim -- "do not go gently into that  good night. Rage rage against the  dying of the light". (he winks goodbye)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids running up to grab JIM, pulls him back to the pa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come 'ere Uncle Jim, we're playing  blind man's bluff...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JIM, a bearded Santa Claus with the birthday hat on his h surrounded by the GIRLS and BOYS and DOROTHY shooting a h movie. They're eating birthday cake but UNCLE JIM is drin straight from the cognac bottle -- a strange sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Robin) So what are you gonna be when you  grow up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanna be your wife

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He laughs, looks at Dorothy who's shooting him with the S 8.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, can I afford you? Pam  kinda wiped me out with her dress  store y'know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll make my own dresses and you'll  see, I'll be the best wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding) You'll never be alone Jim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Dorothy) You know I've never been happier.  Not as much of a rush as I used to  be in y'know... this is the strangest  life I've ever known.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes on a LITTLE BOY who's walking into the party, si down with the others, ignored, isolated, a birthday cap o his head. Clothes belong to the 1940's and the face seems familiar. Jim is not sure, woozy from the cognac. As he f We saw the Boy many years ago in the backseat of the car the Arizona desert. Jim's head falling gently into his folded arms on the tab the cognac bottle at his elbow, merlin hat on, beard, the kids laughing, pulling his ears and nose -- he doesn't wa up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Ray comes over now, rouses him gently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta plane to catch man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim coming awake in that instant alert way of his, but  obviously hung over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O?... splittling headache from which  the future is made.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puzzling remark, He gets up, shaky, exits, kids tearing a him. Goodbyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The beach is behind them, the last of the frisbee players and dogs, the skaters go by, as we continue to hear RIDER from within.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Pam really there in Paris waiting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ironic, head hurts) Sure. The Count's there so where  else would she be? Gotta try to start  over, without all the hassles, y'know.  I think we can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never knew what you saw in that  nightmare chick man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well she is kinda flakey -- like me.  I mean she's just so vulnerable about  everything. It makes me sad man. (pause) But she's always kinda believed in  something about me y'know -- her  little picture of me as the unsung  poet -- and it's a fantasy I kinda  dig y'know, 'stead of the one I live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know man, I don't wanna sound  like your old man but you're only  27, you're living like you gotta get  it all in, you gotta slow down man,  you did it, you broke thru to the  other side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We didn't break thru Ray, we just  pushed things a little. When you  really break thru, there's nothing  left. No music, no Doors, no God,  nothing -- only a will to power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe that. You were an  American prince, man -- with overbred  genes -- (Jim scoffs, laughs) No! What could've been Jim? You  could've been President. (Jim cracks up) No man! What could've been Jim? We  stood here on this beach on the edge  of the Pacific that crazy summer day  in '65 -- and we knew, you and I, we  knew we were at the edge of the mind.  we were there, man. One planet, one  globe, one mind. Consciousness, we  raised it, we were there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim, not the sentimental type, climbs in his car, amused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now? (smiles, lethally  sweet) You've made me into Ishmael. I am  the last survivor of the Pequod. And  I exist only to tell the story of  Ahab who fought the black whale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loves it, laughs) It was white Ray. You gotta stop  harpin' on that day. I was so ripped  I can hardly remember it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ignites engine. Ray leans in, lightening up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what was that poem you once  wrote about two chicks on the pier?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on man, I gotta fly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. Just once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (VOICE OVER, pulling  out the car) In that year we had a great  Visitation of energy  Back in those days  Everything was simpler and more  confused  One summer night, going to the pier  I ran into two young girls  The blonde was called Freedom  The dark one Enterprise  We talked  And they told me this story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he departs, waving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (OVER) What was the story?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His point of view -- Jim receding into the sun in his mus making a shakey, screeching curve at the bend of the beac And he's gone. An ominous ROAR of an AIRPLANE above RAY. flying away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PLANE flies off into the setting ball of red sun. INT. RECORDING SESSION (LAST SESSION) - L.A. - DEC. The bearded POET hunches in his chair, exhausted, clutchi the paper, finished. Pause. He downs a final shot, grunts the Indian Ghostman sitting there on a stool watching him the corner of the studio. The Ghostman laughs (but nothin comes out of his mouth). His wrinkled eyes are happy,  feathered ponytail, he nods... pleased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, didja get all that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You done good, Jim, go now -- rest

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ENGINEER, exhausted, doesn't feel anything funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I got it Jim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The poets face brightens. A small but ever-so-sweet smile triumph hikes up the corners of his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw right. Let's get some tacos!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands, sways, than moves out of view. The empty bottl of whiskey, its sands run out, is left behind. As we FADE OUT, a hardy, mischievous Morrison laugh and a ripple of sensuous MUSIC carry us into the lilting, lamen strains of AN AMERICAN PRAYER -- THE END without lyrics f now as we cut to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAMELA is agitated in her sleep -- waking as she feels hi watching. Is that him? At the door? A SHADOW -- leaves.  Footsteps moving down the narrow Parisian corridor with t creaky floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim... that you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks at the time. Somewhere near dawn. The sounds of a b being drawn. Nightmare or sleep? She tries to fade back t sleep but the MUSIC and the WHISPERING prod her, pull her awake... DISSOLVE: SAME FACE -- AN HOUR LATER. Putting her robe on, the slippers, the light... moving. S is much more ravaged looking than before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She finds him now... His face floating upwards, angelic e the beard is now gone, a little smile on his face. He mus be playing another joke. Although she really knows as she says the words:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim! It was you. I always know when  it's you. (moving closer) Come on baby get out of the tub...  mama'll dry you off... (pause) Jim Morrison, now you stop joking  you hear me, cut it out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His face. At peace, as she sobs, the MUSIC cresting to Ji lyrics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...was it all right Jim, did you  enjoy it when it came my baby? Just  like you said it'd be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (OVER) They are waiting to take us into the  severed garden do you know how pale  and wanton thrillful comes death at  a strange hour? Unannounced unplanned  for like a scaring overfriendly guest  you've brought to bed? Death makes  angels of us all? And gives us wings  where we had shoulders smooth as  raven's claws...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His face etching into a perfect Alexandrine bust of physi beauty. The camera moving to reveal, a wintry day, leaves blowing, the wild cats everywhere in the empty cemetery, crumbling tombs, the flowers fresh and dead around Jim's  tomb, the graffiti, wine bottles, Wilde, Bizet, Piaf, Cho Morrison...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (OVER) No more money, no more fancy dress  this other kingdom seems by far the  best until its other jaw reveals  incest and loose obedience to a  vegetable law. I will not go I prefer  a feast of friends to the giant  family...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MUSIC rolling up on: INT. CORRIDOR & STAGE - LIMBO Smoke. Some lights. The distant cheers of a CROWD. In sli SLOW MOTION, a FIGURE moves down a corridor into a blindi light of stage and smoke. THREE OTHER SHADOWS are there  waiting -- as the GHOST moves to the microphone in altere motion. The AUDIENCE is out there somewhere in the dark -- we sen they too have become ghosts, as all of us will one day. T MUSIC continuing up to roll from AMERICAN PRAYER -- THE E snatches we annotate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and Gentlemen, from Los Angeles  California -- The Doors! (ghostly applause) JIM & THE DOORS (snatches) ...have you seen the warm progress  under the stars?  Have you forgotten the keys to the  kingdom?  Have you been born yet and are you  alive?  Where is the feast we were promised?  Let's reinvent the gods, the myths  of the ages!  We need great golden copulations

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camera closing past the DOORS to JIM alone, circling the  mike with his dance -- the INDIAN GHOSTMAN jigging, shama like, off to the side -- now levitating above the stage, crazy, gawky dancing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'll tell you a story of  whiskey, mystics and men  And about the believers and how the  whole thing began  First there were women and children  obeying the moon  Then daylight brought wisdom and  sickness too soon... the moon is a  dry blood beast  We have assembled inside this ancient  and insane theatre to propagate our  lust for life and flee the swarming  wisdom of the streets we live we die  and death not ends it (screams in agony) FATHER HAVE MERCY!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ending with a solitary sing-song croak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bird of prey, bird of prey  Flying high, flying high in the summer  sky  Bird of prey, bird of prey flying  high, flying high gently pass by  Bird of prey, bird of prey flying  high, flying high  Take me on your flight (pause then) I will come again down from the wild  mountains

dialogues.speaker: BLACK SCREEN WITH CREDITS
dialogues.text: ...Let's lighten it up with some good old rock and roll. we hear Jim and the Doors running loose on ROADHOUSE BLUE JIM & DOORS ALRITE YEAH YEAH  YOU GOTTA ROLL, ROLL, ROLL  YOU GOTTA THRILL MY SOUL -- ALRITE  ROLL, ROLL, ROLL, ROLL,  A THRILL MY SOUL  A-GOT-A-BEEPA, GONCHA CHUCHNA HOCA  CONK,  A DONTA EATCHA COONA NEECHA BOP-A- LOOLA, LECHOW, BOMPA KECHOW YESOW  CONK, YEAH  RITE ASHEN LADY (X2)  GIVE UP YOUR VOWS (X2)  SAVE OUR CITY (X2)  RIGHT NOW (X2)  WELL I WOKE UP THIS MORNING I GOT  MYSELF A BEER (X2)  THE FUTURE'S UNCERTAIN THE END IS  ALWAYS NEAR  LET IT ROLL BABY ROLL (X3)  ALL NITE LONG
